newsitem.title: INDIA: CRICKET-CULLINAN HELPS S.AFRICA CLINCH THIRD STRAIGHT WIN.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-CULLINAN HELPS S.AFRICA CLINCH THIRD STRAIGHT WIN.

text.p: A century by Darryll Cullinan helped South Africa to a 27-run victory over India to maintain their unbeaten run in the Titan Cup triangular one-day series at Jaipur's Sawai Man Singh Stadium on Wednesday.
Put into bat by Indian skipper Sachin Tendulkar, who won the toss, South Africa scored 249 for six and then restricted India to 222 for seven in 50 overs.
Having won all their three matches so far in the round-robin league, they lead the standings with six points and seem assured of a place in the final on November 6.
India have one win from three games and Australia have lost both their matches.
For South Africa, man-of-the-match Cullinan scored 106 off 124 balls and starred in a 113-run third wicket partnership with skipper Hansie Cronje, who scored 58 from 73 balls.
Tendulkar and left-handed Saurav Ganguly made a solid yet relatively slow start for India with a 126-run first-wicket stand, however India's middle-order failed to capitalise on their groundwork.

Tendulkar (64 off 93 balls), going for a big hit, was caught by Gary Kirsten at deep mid-on off medium-pacer Brian McMillan. With his next delivery McMillan had Rahul Dravid caught behind. He finished with three for 32 from nine overs.
Paceman Allan Donald uprooted the off stump of Ganguly (54 off 104 balls) with a yorker.
Mohammed Azharuddin waged a lone battle to remain unbeaten on 56 from 60 balls but found his team mates heading back in a procession in their effort to step up the run rate.
Javagal Srinath, Ajay Jadeja, Pankaj Dharmani and Anil Kumble fell attempting wild strokes.
"The bowlers did a great job in pegging down the Indian batsmen," Cronje said. "The Indian openers kept them in the game and we were beginning to get worried until Tendulkar got out."
"Cullinan played a gallant knock to enable us post a fighting score," he said.
